meaning: A liquid or solution capable of conducting electricity due to an ionic compound being melted or dissolved.
A conductor at either the positive or negative terminal of a power supply.
The decomposition of an ionic compound using electricity.
Also called the anode - the electrode which negative ions move towards
Also called the cathode - the electrode which positive ions move towards.
A simple ionic compound electrolysed in molten state using inert electrodes. The metal is produced at the negative electrode and the non-metal at the positive
The electrolysis of an aqueous solution, where either hydrogen or the metal is produced at the negative electrode, and either oxygen or a halogen is produced at the positive.
The extraction of aluminium from bauxite by electrolysis using a molten mixture of aluminium oxide and cryolite where carbon is the positive electrode.
